result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly J Aker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.  Huber allowed.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  ** Pay fine of $ 200.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: For Ct 2 only - Dismissed and read in.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Kelly J Aker, appeared with Attorney Lauren Jane Breckenfelder.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In.  15CM1044 also read in.  Sentencing arguments made.  Court imposes and stays 90 days in the KCJ w/ huber.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  Credit for 18 days if revoked.   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and notice is given.  Court imposes a fine of $200 plus costs including DNA surcharge.  Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.
Atty:  L Breckenfelder.

15CM1044/15CM1086/15CM1266
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Lauren Breckenfelder. Clerk: PT
Atty Breckenfelder states she will likely be handling all 3 files now that she has been appointed on the new file.  Atty Breckenfelder request an adjournment to see if a global resolution can be reached.  FPT on 10/30/15 at 8:30 AM.
